intro: Haploesthes greggii, commonly known as Gregg's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Haploesthes greggii is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun.
